extendedIngredients.name: banana
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 1/2 to 6 cups of mixed fresh berries and slices of banana (berries can include boysenberries, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries)
metaInformation: (berries can include boysenberries, strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, and blackberries)

recipes.title: Berry and Banana Terrine
recipes.instructions: 1  In  a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over 1/4 cup grape juice; let soften 2 to 3 minutes.2  Heat sugar with another 1/4 cup grape juice in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until dissolved.  Remove from heat; stir in softened gelatin until dissolved, then stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups grape juice.3  Place berries in a 4-by-8-inch (6 cup capacity) loaf pan; pour gelatin mixture over, pressing berries gently to submerge completely (remove a few berries if necessary.)  Refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.4  To unmold, dip bottom of pan in hot water about 5 seconds.  Invert onto a serving platter, and shake firmly to relase.  Slice to serve.Serve with whipped cream.

steps.step: 1  In  a small bowl, sprinkle gelatin over 1/4 cup grape juice; let soften 2 to 3 minutes.2
Heat sugar with another 1/4 cup grape juice in a small saucepan over medium-high heat until dissolved.
Remove from heat; stir in softened gelatin until dissolved, then stir in remaining 1 1/2 cups grape juice.3

Place berries in a 4-by-8-inch (6 cup capacity) loaf pan; pour gelatin mixture over, pressing berries gently to submerge completely (remove a few berries if necessary.)  Refrigerate until firm, at least 3 hours.4  To unmold, dip bottom of pan in hot water about 5 seconds.  Invert onto a serving platter, and shake firmly to relase.  Slice to serve.
